publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4728 Euan Robson: The Commemoration of Black Friday—That the Parliament remembers with respect the east coast disaster of 14 October 1881 in which 189 east coast fishermen, of whom 129 came from Eyemouth, lost their lives; recognises the efforts of Berwickshire coastal towns, villages and others to commemorate the 125th anniversary of Black Friday, the worst fishing tragedy ever suffered in Scotland, and further recognises both the dangers faced by contemporary fishermen at sea and the continuing importance of the fishing industry to communities around Scotland’s shores.
S2M-4728 The Commemoration of Black Friday (lodged on 28 August 2006) Christine Grahame*
S2M-4728 The Commemoration of Black Friday (lodged on 28 August 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-4728 The Commemoration of Black Friday (lodged on 28 August 2006) Murray Tosh*

S2M-4728 The Commemoration of Black Friday (lodged on 28 August 2006) Karen Gillon*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Robin Harper*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Bruce Crawford*, Alex Neil*, Mike Pringle*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Derek Brownlee*, Helen Eadie*, John Home Robertson*, Eleanor Scott*, Tommy Sheridan*, Brian Adam*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Stewart Stevenson*

S2M-4728 The Commemoration of Black Friday (lodged on 28 August 2006) Richard Lochhead*, Chris Ballance*, Alex Fergusson*, Jeremy Purvis*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Paul Martin*, Carolyn Leckie*, Richard Baker*, Sarah Boyack*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Nora Radcliffe*, Murdo Fraser* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-4728 The Commemoration of Black Friday (lodged on 28 August 2006) Trish Godman*, John Swinburne* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-4728 The Commemoration of Black Friday (lodged on 28 August 2006) Dave Petrie*
